description:
First meeting so let's keep it a bit informal: who in Belgium does what with node.js?

The agenda:

- introduction to the node.js user group by Steven Beeckman

- Q&A on how the community is using node.js already

- Talk on http://nodeknockout.com/ and a node.js XMPP bot by Xavier Dutoit

Kindly hosted by Floating Desk, a co-working space on a boat in Ghent!
name: 1st meeting

description:
Since deploying is closely related to testing, Julien Biezemans will give a talk about cucumber.js. (Julien is the lead dev of cucumber.js.)

Simone Chiaretta will present how to deploy MongoDB powered node.js apps can be deployed to Azure.

Ruben Vermeersch will talk about systemd:

Deploying Node.js with systemd: you can have the magic of the cloud too! Cloud deployment platforms like Heroku and Nodejitsu contain a lot of infrastructure for managing your application: monitoring, automatic launching, log capturing, ... In this talk we'll have a look at systemd, the service manager on a number of Linux distributions. Systemd allows you to deploy your Node.js applications with the same advanced features, turning your own server into something that's as professional as the cloud, while keeping all the control.

Presentations will start around 8pm so no need to stress when in traffic.
name: Testing & deploying node.js apps

description:
During meetup #2 (reminder: on 16 Jan 2013 at Microsoft Belgium) we will have explored how to test and deploy our node.js applications. Meetup #3 will explore the most interesting frameworks and packages (e.g. Express.js for web apps, socket.io vs sockjs, Passport for authentication, ...). People who want to show how one should use one of the above frameworks are kindly invited to give a presentation.

This third meetup is kindly hosted by Combell.
name: #njugbe meetup #3: Exploring some frameworks and interesting packages

description:
Agenda:

- Toon Ketels (@toonketels) and Anthony Ringoet (@mylittletony) on Grunt.js.

- ARDrone & socket.io (@stevenbeeckman)

There is still room for one or two extra sessions, so if you want to show something node.js, mention @njug_be on Twitter.
name: #njugbe meetup #4

description:
Meetup #5 will be our summer meetup, and is kindly hosted by iChoosr. If you have something node.js related you want to talk about, or want to know something about: get in touch!

Steven
@njug_be

Agenda:

19h30: welcome

20h00: @patrickdebois will give a talk on the operational side of node.js

20h35: @eschnou will talk about nodecopter and more specific on using OpenCV and linear algebra to control your favorite node.js controlled copter. Next level!

21h10: aftermath
name: #njugbe meetup #5

description:
On Wednesday, October 2nd Q-music will host the 6th #njugbe meeting in Vilvoorde. People from Small Town Heroes and Q-music will present on how they used node.js to implement realtime communication in big media-productions. Internal technologies, as well as external services will be discussed.


There is plenty of parking space, just drive up to the leftmost barrier and it will open. You can't miss the entrance, just let the kind people of reception know you are there for the node.js usergroup and they will show you the way!

Agenda:

19u30: Reception + sandwiches


20u00: From node to node
From second screen to television studio. Architecture overview and production experiences.
- Ilja Strobbe
After finishing his studies in physics, Ilja started at the R&D department of VRT (VRT medialab). After 3 years, he joined the spin-off Small Town Heroes as a software-engeneer.

20u30: Scaling websockets with NodeJS - The hard way
We look at the steps we took to get a generic websocket solutions deployed and the effort it took to keep it online for Q-music.be.Realtime push component. Node.js, redis, performance and scaling. Architecture walkthrough and deployment experiences.
- Jan De Poorter & Serge Koval
Jan De Poorter is founder of SumoCoders, and has been programming for the web for over 10 years. He collaborates on a lot of open-source projects and loves trying out new technologies in production.

21u00: Meteor realtime framework
Introduction, what's inside, ideology, high-level walkthrough, real life experience and why one should avoid it at.
- Serge Koval: Serge is 31 years old holds a master degree in computer science. Toying with computers since age of 8 (ZX Spectrum). Started with assembly language, then moved to higher level languagesprefer to use python, if possible.

21u20: Open Discussion
 - Moderator: Hendrik Dacquin


21u45: Lets all have a drink!
name: #njugbe meetup #6: Node.js and mainstream media

description:
Meetup 7 is kindly hosted by Mobile Vikings.

7.00pm: pizza

7.30pm: https & authentication by Jeroen Moors

8.15pm: Unit testing with mocha.js and chai.js by Toon Ketels

9.15pm: drinks
name: #njugbe meetup #7

description:
As mentioned in previous meetups, we're organising a JavaScript devroom at FOSDEM 2014, the largest european (semi) unconference about open-source software. Place to be is the ULB on Sunday, February 2nd.

The line-up of talks is pretty diverse as it covers both front-end as back-end JavaScript. Check it out at https://fosdem.org/2014/schedule/track/javascript/ !
name: FOSDEM - JavaScript devroom

description:
Hi there,

after the very successful JavaScript devroom at FOSDEM it's time for our following meetup. One of the speakers will be Storify's Xavier Damman, who's coming over from Silicon Valley.

Agenda:


7pm: welcome drinks & pizza kindly provided by Woorank

7.30pm: Xavier Damman

8.30pm: Woorank - Scaling node.js apps with Docker and nginx

9.30pm: drinks & mingling
name: Meetup 9: Silicon Node.js

description:
Hi all,

we're meeting up with the Belgian Internet of Things User Group on August 27th at iMinds in Ghent. The topic will be: scripting the internet of things, in two rooms.

Agenda: 

19:00 - 20:20 Part 1 

·  Introduction Node.js (30 min)  (Steven Beeckman)

·  Flow Based Programming with node-RED and Reactive Programming with bacon.js (30 min) (Sven Beauprez)

 20:20 - 20:30 Short introduction/pitch of the hands-on sessions.  
(max 2 minutes/session) 

 20:30 - 22:15 Part 2 

Hands-on/demo sessions:

·  BBB & Node.js by Frederik Santens

·  Arduino & Node.js by Steven Beeckman

·  Tessel.io & Node.js by Sven Beauprez & Daan Kets

·  eLua / Screvle by Ronald Vanschoren

·  Samsung Galaxy Gear Remote Controlled Led Lights by Christophe Scholliers

·  Home brewery installation by Stijn Deknudt

22:15 - ...  Networking & drinks 

Special thanks to iMinds for hosting this event!
name: Special Meetup: Node.js & Internet of Things

description:
Hi node.js'ers,

after a six month hiatus (sorry for that), we'll be having our 10th meetup.

This is the agenda:

• 19h: arrival


• 19h30: An alternative to express.js: deep.js. Deep.js is an isomorphic framework for better programming


• 20h30: node.js in production: DataCamp case study. DataCamp is a cool belgian startup enabling online data analysis courses and they have been used for some Coursera courses. They will detail their architecture (which mostly runs on AWS).


• 21h10: mingling


We'll be hosted in the new offices of WooRank (Boulevard Louis Schmidt 29, next to the ICAB building), and they'll also provide us with drinks.

Sponsors for food are also welcome to get in touch.


Cheerio,

Steven
@njug_be - @stevenbeeckman
name: #njugbe meetup #10
